headline.main: Last Dispatch From the Front (of the House)

docs.abstract: Now that we are entering our second year in Bridgehampton and our second restaurant, in Brooklyn, the start-up is over. And so is the chronicle.
docs.snippet: Now that we are entering our second year in Bridgehampton and our second restaurant, in Brooklyn, the start-up is over. And so is the chronicle.

docs.abstract: Political news from today's Times and around the Web, plus a look at what's happening in Washington.
docs.snippet: Political news from today's Times and around the Web, plus a look at what's happening in Washington.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Republican-dominated State House passed a bill on Wednesday that would exempt employers with religious objections from having to cover contraception for employees.

headline.main: New Hampshire: Bill Would End Requirement on Contraceptives Coverage Among Some Employers
headline.print_headline: New Hampshire: Bill Would End Requirement On Contraceptives Coverage Among Some Employers

docs.abstract: New Hampshire's Republican-dominated State House passes a bill that would exempt employers with religious objections from having to cover contraception for employees; bill was proposed in opposition to the federal mandate for contraception coverage.
docs.snippet: The Republican-dominated State House passed a bill on Wednesday that would exempt employers with religious objections from having to cover contraception for employees.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hospitals are expected to become larger through mergers to cope with lower reimbursements from Medicare and insurers.

headline.seo: Hospital Groups Will Get Bigger, Moody’s Report Says
headline.main: Hospital Groups Will Get Bigger, Moody’s Predicts
headline.print_headline: Hospital Groups Will Get Bigger, Moody’s Predicts

docs.abstract: Moody's Investors Service report says big hospitals are expected to become larger through mergers to cope with lower reimbursements from Medicare and insurers; notes that the possible emergence of new partners with hospitals include for-profit hospital groups and private equity firms.
docs.snippet: Hospitals are expected to become larger through mergers to cope with lower reimbursements from Medicare and insurers.

docs.lead_paragraph: How four women wielding crowbars rebuilt a derelict Mississippi town to fit their lives.

headline.seo: How Four Women Revived a Derelict Mississippi Town
headline.main: They Made Main Street Their Own
headline.print_headline: They Made Main Street Their Own

docs.abstract: Coulter Fussell, Megan Patton, Erin Austen Abbott and Alexe van Beuren are part of a new wave of young female business and house owners who are revitalizing Water Valley, a derelict Mississippi town of just under 4,000 people.
docs.snippet: How four women wielding crowbars rebuilt a derelict Mississippi town to fit their lives.

docs.lead_paragraph: As the health care system braces for a wave of baby boomers, many are already helping others, serving as patient advocates and providing clinics with management help.

headline.seo: Baby Boomers Step Up as Health Care Volunteers
headline.main: Found: Older Volunteers to Fill Labor Shortage
headline.print_headline: Found: Older Volunteers to Fill Labor Shortage

docs.abstract: Older volunteers are getting involved in programs that train them to help their peers navigate the health care system and provide other services, like arranging transportation; encouraged by an emphasis on primary care, care coordination and chronic disease management, pilot programs are emerging to try to improve the fragmented medical system.
docs.snippet: As the health care system braces for a wave of baby boomers, many are already helping others, serving as patient advocates and providing clinics with management help.

docs.lead_paragraph: Doctors are not flocking to treat the aging population, especially because of low Medicare reimbursements, leading to projections of severe shortages of health care professionals.

headline.seo: Needed: Health Providers to Treat the Aging
headline.main: Needed: Health Professionals to Treat the Aging
headline.print_headline: Wanted: Health Professionals To Treat the Aging

docs.abstract: Doctors are increasingly reluctant to treat the aging population, causing concern among health experts who say they expect severe shortages of health care professionals for retirees and the elderly.
docs.snippet: Doctors are not flocking to treat the aging population, especially because of low Medicare reimbursements, leading to projections of severe shortages of health care professionals.

docs.lead_paragraph: Retirement plans at many nonprofit institutions look similar to the private sector’s 401(k)’s, but employees often have more opportunities to assess goals.

headline.seo: Homework for Teachers: Their Investment Plans
headline.main: Homework for Teachers: Their Investment Plans
headline.print_headline: Homework for Teachers: Their Investment Plans

docs.abstract: Retirement plans at many nonprofit institutions, known as 403(b) plans, look similar to the private sector’s 401(k) plans, but employees often have more opportunities to assess goals since federal regulations enacted in 2009 required employees to more directly involved in running them.
docs.snippet: Retirement plans at many nonprofit institutions look similar to the private sector’s 401(k)’s, but employees often have more opportunities to assess goals.
